lines.gurmukhi: jYsy qwq mwq igRh jnmq suq Gny; skl n hoq smsr gun gQ jI [

Unknown.translation: Just as several sons are born to a parent, but all are not virtuous to the same extent.

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: ijvyˆ mwˆ bwp dy Gr Anyk puqR jMmdy hn, pr swry guxwˆ dI pUMjI ivc ieko ijhy nhIˆ huMdy[

lines.gurmukhi: ctIAw Anyk jYsy AwvYN ctswl ibKY; pVq n eyksy srb hr kQ jI [

Unknown.translation: Just as there are several students in a school, but all of them are not proficient in understanding a subject to the same extent.

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: ijvyˆ pwTSwlw ivc Anyk ividAwrQI Awauˆdy hn, pr swry hrI kQw ieko ijhI nhIˆ pVHdy[

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy ndI nwv imil bYTq Anyk pMQI; hoq n smwn sBY clq hYN pQ jI [

Unknown.translation: Just as several passengers travel in a boat, but all of them have different destinations. Everyone goes his own way 00 leaving the boat.

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: ijvyˆ ndI qoˆ pwr hox leI byVI aupr Anykwˆ rwhI iml bYTdy hn, pr swry ieko hI rwh dy c`lx vwly nhIˆ huMdy, koeI iksy pwsy clw jwdw hY, koeI iksy pwsy[

lines.gurmukhi: qYsy gur crn srn hYN Anyk isK; siqgur krn kwrn smrQ jI [583[

Unknown.translation: Similarly, several Sikhs of different aptitude take refuge of the True Guru, but the cause of all causes--the capable True Guru makes them alike by bestowing on them the elixir of Naam.  (583)

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: iqvyˆ gurU crnwˆ dI Srn Awey hoey Anyk isK hn, smrQ siqgurU swry kwrnwˆ dy krn vwly hn ]583 ]
